body:
I'm afraid it can't be easily fixed except editing the world geojson for this specific scene. 

You can describe your purpose and let's see if we can work around .it
You can try indexing the custom parameters by yourself with the name in params

We need to set the position of the point based on the latitude and longitude on the map, 
and I am worried that there will be such a special point.
You can try to search the neighbor points by adding a small offset if you can't get result. I think it will raise the success possibility.

uh, that's a good plan B.
Thanks for your help~
Test case has added.
@catscarlet  Do you mean that you always want blank area at the start and end of the diagram?

@catscarlet 

And I have updated the demo:
https://gallery.echartsjs.com/editor.html?c=xync4-wJe&v=3
where `dataZoom.start` and `dataZoom.end` are added for the first screen.
It probably matches your requirement I think.

> @catscarlet Do you mean that you always want blank area at the start and end of the diagram?

Yes.

> @catscarlet
> 
> And I have updated the demo:
> https://gallery.echartsjs.com/editor.html?c=xync4-wJe&v=3
> where `dataZoom.start` and `dataZoom.end` are added for the first screen.
> It probably matches your requirement I think.

Well I saw you use 10 and 90 as start and end. They are percent, not value. Sadly I already knew that I 
 can use percent instead of value to avoid this issue, but that also means I need to calculate a percent when I only have a precise value to set.

I agree. Find the largest height is a practical way. 
And about "place in some blank area", I am not sure how the labels are able to connect to the polygon if all of the label need to be displayed.
Fixed in https://github.com/ecomfe/zrender/pull/519

Provide some info about this issue:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1956569/67639892-751b9880-f930-11e9-9219-8f29396bbeae.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1956569/67639888-659c4f80-f930-11e9-8090-ee33caaccb3b.png)

Now the question is:
`connect` works based on `chart.makeActionFromEvent`. But `connect` is a common feature and use a common way to generate an action from a event. That is, current connect do not know how the charts should be connected accurately. It just use a fuzzy way to connect charts.

To solve this problem, probably their are two ways:

(1) If `connect` do not match the requirement of users accurately, do not use `connect`, but connect charts manually. That is, listen to one chart and convert the `event` to `action parameters` manually (with user customized convert logic) and call `dispatchAction` to the other charts.
The backwards of the way is that it probably brings lot of burden to users to listen every events the needed (for example, including `highlight/downplay`, `updateAxisPointer`, `hideTip`, ...)

(2) Enhance the current `connect` feature. Enable it to customize the `chart.makeActionFromEvent` by users.

(3) Any other ideas?

[
    { "name": "3", "children": [] },
    { "name": "3", "children": [{ "name": "2", "children": [] }, { "name": "" }] },
    { "name": "2", "children": [{ "name": "1", "children": [] }, { "name": "3", "children": [] }] },
    { "name": "2", "children": [{ "name": "1", "children": [] }, { "name": "3", "children": [{ "name": "" }, { "name": "4", "children": [] }] }] },
]

My unfinished samples（我的未完成示例）：https://github.com/hy31337/Demo/tree/master/HTML/Echarts/map_River_Lake/Example

Hi @100pah and @pissang - thank you for your replies!

If I could have figured out a way to use the seriesId then I would have, so the `\0` feature is definitely useful (otherwise I wouldn't have known not to use it). Looking at the console output it did look like a bug though.

What about generating a seriesId at runtime? Then a developer would know that they simply can't use seriesId since it would change on every page refresh.
I think this problem is solved by commit #11447

Since the discussion above, we can define `series.themeRiver.label` as below:
 ```js
label: {
    position: 'left' or 'right' or 'inside'
}
```
While with the position `left' or 'right', the label may overlapping as the picture referenced in the issue show, so we should discuss a proposal to solve this problem.
We seem to solve this problem before, and it works normally on my computer.  Do you still have this problem?
Hi all, this feature released in version 4.4.0, I am so sorry about it. Please try it.

Just retested with 4.4.0 and the scrolling works now. The only problem is when I have a long text and the first part is shown. After the scroll, I will see the second legend item and not the second part of the long text.

Try using [event.Mouse.events.mousedown](https://echarts.apache.org/en/api.html#events.Mouse%20events.mousedown) instead of event.Mouse.events.mousedown.click. When the event returns 'event.which === 3', that refers to a right click so the code to cancel the highlight will go in that condition ('event.which: 1' is left click).
I have a similar problem like this, probably echarts cuts the rest number with rounding at third decimal place .Maybe understandable, however, bad user experience.

I think a better experience for dragging is keeping the state when the mouse is outside of chart. Currently it's really annoying when dragging on a dataZoom closing to the edge of chart.

If we bring this, #10675  will not be an issue.
@baoqger  Since you haven't reply for a long time, so I will close this issue. If you still have any problem in the future you can reopen it.
This feature is supported with this [configuration](https://www.echartsjs.com/zh/option.html#series-tree.roam) `series-tree.roam`
